related_facts.fact_group_content: UBS base-case target of $3,500/oz.
InvestingHaven sees potential maximum gold price of $4,400 in 2027.
JP Morgan has an average price target of $2,175 per ounce for bullion in the final quarter of 2024.
Gold’s price forecast for Q1 2024 at Bloomberg Terminal is between $1,913.63-$2,224.22.
David Harper predicted the price of gold could reach $6,800 an ounce by 2040.
The maximum price forecast for 2028 sits near the $4,000 mark.
Gold will trade in a broad range between $2,916.51 and $4,351.84 in 2025.
Analysts forecast a closing price of $4,412.00 at the end of 2026.
Closing price of $4,722.94 in June 2026.
Experts predict a decline to $4,277.91 by the end of December 2026.
Gold will likely increase to $3,852.81 by mid-2027.
Price may fluctuate within the range of $4,239.11–$5,306.62 in the first half of 2027.

clusters.title: Diverse Forecasts
clusters.description: Gold prices are projected to experience significant fluctuations over the coming years, with various firms providing diverse forecasts. UBS has set a base-case target of $3,500 per ounce, while InvestingHaven predicts a potential maximum of $4,400 by 2027. JP Morgan anticipates an average price of $2,175 per ounce in late 2024. Long-term predictions include a potential rise to $6,800 by 2040, with prices possibly reaching $4,000 by 2028. Analysts foresee a broad trading range and potential peaks in the mid-$4,000s by 2026 and 2027.

clusters.title: Future Fluctuations
clusters.description: Gold prices are projected to experience significant fluctuations over the next few years, with predictions ranging from moderate increases to substantial surges. By 2025, estimates suggest prices could reach between $2,729 and $3,633, with some forecasts predicting even higher values by 2030. Analysts anticipate a potential peak in 2026, followed by a possible decline in 2027.

clusters.title: Future Surges
clusters.description: Gold prices are projected to rise significantly in the coming years, with predictions reaching as high as $4,000 per ounce by 2026 and potentially $10,000 by 2050. Goldman Sachs has updated its forecast, predicting a rise to $3,700 by the end of 2025. Various scenarios suggest a range of outcomes, with some forecasts indicating a potential surge to $5,000 per ounce within the next two years.

clusters.title: Long-term Peaks
clusters.description: Gold prices are projected to fluctuate significantly over the coming years, with various forecasts indicating potential highs and lows. In 2024, the average price for gold was $2,388 per troy ounce, with predictions suggesting it could reach as high as $3,200 by the end of 2025. Long-term forecasts vary, with some estimates predicting a peak price of $5,155 by 2030, while others suggest a more conservative rise to $2,950. Central bank purchases and market dynamics will likely influence these trends.

The minimum price forecast for 2028 is $2,535.
Dukascopy projects price rising to $2,950 by 2030.
InvestingHaven estimates peak price of $5,155 by 2030.
In 2024, the average price for gold stood at 2,388 U.S. dollars per troy ounce.
The World Bank predicts the price of gold will be an average of $1,950 per ounce in 2024.
Goldman Sachs analysts initially expected the price of gold to remain stable at around $1,970 an ounce between 2023 and 2026.
Citi cut 0-3 month forecast from $3,500 to $3,300 per ounce.
Central bank purchases could reach an average of 70 tonnes per month.

2025 breakout above $3,000/oz.

related_facts.fact_group_content: Goldman Sachs predicts gold prices will reach $2,300 by 2025.
Bank of America analysts predict gold prices may test $2,500 if inflation stays high and the Fed pauses rate hikes.
Citigroup analysts predict gold will remain near $2,200 unless something big happens.
Gold could rise to as much as $3,880 a troy ounce in the event of a recession.
Global gold ETF holdings are worth about 1% of outstanding US Treasuries.
Gold prices climbed as much as 30% year-to-date.
Prices peaked at $3,500/oz in April.
Central bank buying is expected to amount to around 900 tonnes in 2025.
JPMorgan expected gold to average $3,675/oz by Q4 2025.
Dukascopy projects potential average price of $2,500 in 2027.
Dukascopy projects price rising to $2,650 in 2028.
ING expects a fourth-quarter average of $2,100 per ounce in 2024.
For December 2026, Longforecast.com predicts a price of nearly $3,8500.
The World Bank forecasted an average gold price of $2,050 per ounce in 2025.
A 7% increase from the beginning of the year to the end of 2025.

clusters.title: Inflation Impact
clusters.description: Various financial institutions have provided predictions for future gold prices, with estimates ranging from $2,050 to $3,880 per ounce depending on economic conditions such as inflation and potential recessions. Central bank purchases and market dynamics are expected to influence these prices significantly. Notably, Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, and JPMorgan have all projected substantial increases in gold prices over the coming years.
